column1:
If
-9x2+7x-7
(x+12)(x-1)(x-1)
 = A(x+12) + B(x-1) + C(x-1)2

then find the value of A,B and C
column8:
Rearrange the equation in the form
-9x2+7x-7 = A(x-1)(x-1) + B(x+12)(x-1) + C(x+12)
column9:
Based on the above hint , you need to substitute the value of
x = -12 to get the value of A . Substitute the value of A in the
equation and put x = 1 to get the value of C.
Now put the values of A and C in the equation to get the value of B
column10:
Substitute the value of x such that terms B and C are removed
from the equation to get A. Now use this value of A in the
equation and substitute a new value of x to derive the value of C.
Use the values of A and C in equation 1 to derive the value of B
column13: You've got two of the coefficients correct i.e.  VALUES OF A and B but the third coefficient is incorrect. Let's try the next one
column14: You've got two of the coefficients correct i.e.  VALUES OF A and B but the third coefficient is incorrect. Let's try the next one
column15: You've got one of the coefficients correct i.e. VALUE OF A but the other two coefficients are incorrect. Let's try the next one
